title: Skellingthorpe Old Wood Walk Route

images.title: Ian Paterson / Skellingthorpe Heritage Room
images.caption: Skellingthorpe Heritage Room. Small building housing an exhibition which commemorates the role of the World War II bomber airfield of RAF Skellingthorpe and the personnel of 50 and 61 Squadrons who served there.

images.title: Ian Paterson / Approaching Skellingthorpe
images.caption: Approaching Skellingthorpe. Heading eastwards along National Cycle Network Route 64.

images.title: Richard Croft / Bluebells & Wood Anemones
images.caption: Bluebells & Wood Anemones. This part of Skellingthorpe Old Wood is a swathe of woodland plants in late spring

images.title: Richard Croft / Bluebells in Skellingthorpe Old Wood
images.caption: Bluebells in Skellingthorpe Old Wood

description: This historic village is located near Lincoln in North Lincolnshire. This circular walk from the village heads west to explore Skellingthorpe Old Wood. You can follow paths west to the expansive wood where there are miles of trails to try. In the spring you can look out for the lovely bluebells.  There's also attractive oak, conifers, hazel, and lime trees to see in the ancient woodland. Wildlife to look out for includes buzzards, deer and a variety of woodland birds. To continue your reading on the village visit the excellent wikipedia page. There's a wide range of information here on the history and buildings in the settelment. To continue your walking in the area head just a couple of miles south east to visit Hartsholme Country Park and the Swanholme Lakes Nature Reserve. There's a series of pretty lakes and beautiful Victorian landscaped gardens to enjoy here. Whisby Nature Park is also located near here. Just to the south there's another highlight of the area at the Elizabethan Doddington Hall. The hall has some beautiful gardens and a mountain bike trail to try.
